intro: Calyptrospermum integrifolium, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has lance-shaped, hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Calyptrospermum integrifolium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
